data.title: Jonathan Wright Lee (abt.1782-1866)
data.meta_description: Is this your ancestor? Compare DNA and explore genealogy for Jonathan Lee born abt. 1782 Rockingham, Virginia, United States died 1866 Kanawha, West Virginia, United States including ancestors + descendants + 2 genealogist comments + DNA connections + more in the free family tree community.
data.text:
Ancestors Descendants

Profile last modified 9 Aug 2024 | Created 4 Oct 2016

This page has been accessed 450 times.

Contents

1 Biography

1.1 Marriage

2 Sources

3 Research Notes

Biography

Jonathan Right Lee was born in 1782 or 1784 in Rockingham County, Virginia to Zachariah Lee and Jean Right. He died 07 MAY 1866. He married 1st 15 SEP 1806 in Botetourt County, Virginia to Sarah Brickey and had 6 or 7 children. He married 2nd to Delilah Dooley by 1845 and had at least 1 child and maybe 5. (See discussion of marriages and children in Research Notes.)

Marriage

Jonathan married Sarah BRICKEY on 15 Sep 1806 in Botetourt County, Virginia.

Jonathan married a Delilah Dooley.[1]

Botetourt County, Virginia Deeds, Book 30, Paged 545. Family Search.org LDS Film 30715, Image 671 of 703 <br/<

Deed, Botetourt County, Virginia <br/< This indenture made the 22nd day of June in the year of our Lord 1850 between Jonathan Lee and Delila his wife of the county of Botetourt and State of Virginia of the one part, and George F. WHITE assignee of P. CARVIN who was assignee of Aaron BARNES, was assignee of Zachariah [no last name!] of the County of Botetourt and State of Virginia of the other part, witnesseth that the said Jonathan LEE and Delilah his wife, hath, for and in consideration of the sum of fifty dollars to them in hand paid by the said George F. WHITE the receipt whereof is by these presents acknowledged hath granted, bargained and sold and by these presents doth grant, bargain, sell, alien and confirm unto the said George F. WHITE and his heirs forever .... One certain tract or parcel of land it being one fifth part of a two hundred acre tract of land lying and being on the waters of Catawba Creek, a branch of James River. Said tract was purchased by Jonathan LEE from the heirs of John MAHAN dec'd and boundary as follows (long metes and bounds description) ... mentions a path leading to fathers (?) from thence down to where his fence intersects with my meadow fence and down same to a cross fence between our meadow and up the same to the top of the hill and thence down his clover field fence to the creek and up the same for quantity. ... <br/<

Signed: Jonathan R. LEE and Deliah LEE (her mark) <br/<

Virginia, Kanawha County: Acknowledgement that they still want to sell the land, etc. Signed R. E. PUTNEY and Jas. NEWTON <br/<

Botetourt County Court Clerk's Office, the 11th day of NOV 1850. This deed was this day exhibited in this office with the certificate of acknowledgement thereon written and admitted to record. <br/< Signed: Teste Wm. ROBINSON, D. C. <br/<

Note by Niblick-85: This is the only deed we have found where Jonathan signed his middle initial. However, the signature is not in his handwriting.

Research Notes

(By Niblick-85 in AUG 2024, not a descendent of Jonathan Right Lee, but a descendant of Zachariah Lee and Jean Right.)

According to an Ancestry Tree, (link above) Delilah Dooley was born 1813 Botetourt Co. VA and died 23 MAY 1884 Kanawha Co. WV.

It is unknown when Jonathan married Delilah Dooley. The same Ancestry Tree claims it was 1831 and that they had 5 children:

Mary Elizabeth Lee b. 1832 d. 1905

George Lee b. 1834

Lucy Jane Lee b. 1840 d. 1877

Frances Ann Ellen Lee 31 OCT 1846 d. 1931 (confirmed child)

James Washington Lee b. 1850

However, on the 1840 Census, Jonathan's probable wife is 40-49, which is probably Sarah Brickey Lee. So it looks like Jonathan and Delilah married between 1840 and 1846. This would agree with an old Family Group I have which claims George Lee, b. 1834 as a son of Jonathan and Sarah.

Did Sarah die between 1840 and 1846? We have no Find A Grave memorial for her. I have an old Family Group Record that has Sarah's death at 1863/1851 Marmet, West Virginia. (Kanawha County.) Could it be that there was a divorce and she remarried?

Jonathan Right Lee's sister, Mary (Polly) Lee married 01 SEP 1823 to Jacob Dooley. Jacob Dooley and Delilah Dooley are most likely brother and sister. Jacob Dooley and Mary'/Polly Lee were married 01 SEP 1823 in Botetourt County Virginia and lived in Scott Co. VA in 1850 and 1860. Mary/Polly (also called Dolly and Jane) died 01 SEP 1868. Jacob died 06 OCT 1868. Jacob and Mary/Polly named a daughter Delilah. Interesting that they were living next door to Peter and Malinda Brickey in 1850. Peter Brickey b. ca. 1809 Virginia. I was unable to find a connection to Sarah Brickey, but Peter's father William C. Brickey (1779-1865) was born in Botetourt County, Virginia.
